refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This class provides trivial buffering, and additional hooks to be notified of buffer events.

This class can be used for simple sources where there is minimal need for input/output monitoring. For example, it can be used to proxy for a foreign source. We use it for this purpose in evaopensslbufferstream.c to make a connected pair of a BIO (the SSL i/o abstraction) and a GskStream (which is really a GskBufferStream).

Most functions in the API are intended only for "implementors", that is, users who are using a GskBufferStream as an internal stream. Most users who are given a GskBufferStream which is returned as a GskStream should not use this API, because it may conflict with the way the implementor of the function which returned it expects it to be used.

refsect2.title: GskBufferStreamClass
refsect2.para: The class which has the buffer methods.

refsect2.title: GskBufferStream
refsect2.para: The buffered stream. All of its members are private and should be accessed through the methods below only.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_read_hook()
refsect2.para: Get a pointer to a hook on the buffered-read method. This hook will be triggered as long as the stream's read-hook wants data and the buffer is empty.

listitem.simpara: the GskBufferStream to get the read-hook for.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_write_hook()
refsect2.para: Get a pointer to a hook of the buffered-write method. This will be triggered as long as the write-buffer is non-empty.

listitem.simpara: the GskBufferStream to get the write-hook for.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_read_buffer_changed ()
refsect2.para: Called to notify the buffer stream that its read-size has been changed, usually because an implementor has appended data into it for the attached stream to read.

listitem.simpara: stream whose read buffer has been modified.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_write_buffer_changed ()
refsect2.para: Called to notify the buffer stream that its write-buffer has been changed, usually because an implementor has read data from it.

listitem.simpara: stream whose write buffer has been modified.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_read_shutdown ()
refsect2.para: Shutdown the read-end of the buffer-stream, waiting for the buffer to be drained first.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_changed ()
refsect2.para: Do all updates needed to compensate for any user changes to: read_buffer, write_buffer, max_write_buffer.

listitem.simpara: the stream whose internals have been modified.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_clear_strict_max_write()
refsect2.para: Stop forcing the buffer-writer to be in strict-compliance with the max-write-buffer quantity. In this case, max-write-buffer just used for polling purposes.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_has_strict_max_write()
refsect2.para: Whether the GskBufferStream will strictly enforce the maximum write-buffer threshold by forcing writes beyond the maximum to get clipped (possibly to 0).

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_get_max_write_buffer()
refsect2.para: Get the maximum number of bytes in the write buffer.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_peek_write_buffer()
refsect2.para: Peek at the write-buffer (the buffer where the input eva_stream_write() is appended). Note that you must call eva_buffer_stream_write_buffer_changed() if you change the returned buffer.

listitem.simpara: the stream whose write-buffer is returned.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_peek_read_buffer()
refsect2.para: Peek at the read-buffer (the buffer where the output eva_stream_read() is drain from). Note that you must call eva_buffer_stream_read_buffer_changed() if you change the returned buffer.

listitem.simpara: the stream whose read-buffer is returned.

refsect2.title: eva_buffer_stream_mark_strict_max_write()
refsect2.para: Indicate that strict enforcement of the maximum-write buffer size is desired.
Note that this only affect the write implementation: existing buffered data is retained, and also the implementor can always eva_buffer_append() to cram extra data in.

listitem.simpara: the stream where the max-write-buffer should be strictly enforced.
